patterns: What are the rules and regulations of the college?
Can you tell me about the college policies?
Are there any specific guidelines I need to follow in the college?
What are the disciplinary measures at the college?
Where can I find information about the code of conduct?
give me the college rules and regulation
responses:
Students should wear ID CARD inside the campus.
Students should not disturb the classes by unnecessarily     
making noise, standing on the corridor, lounge, etc.
Students are strictly forbidden from smoking anywhere in the campus.
Students are not allowed to use mobile phones anywhere in the campus.
Students are allowed to organise or attend any meeting in the institution or outside only with the prior permission of  the Principal / HOD.
Students may use two-wheelers of capacity less than 100 cc only.  They      should have valid driving licence and should ride within the speed limit of 10 km/hr within the campus. Students should wear safety helmets.
Students should handle college property carefully without causing any damage.

patterns: Could you please provide me with the history of the college?
I would like to request information regarding the historical background of the college.
Would it be possible to get some information about the college's history?
May I have details about the historical development of the college, please?
Can you tell me about the history of the college?
What is the historical background of this college?
Tell me about the history of this college.
What is the historical background of this college?
Can you give me some information about the early years of this college?
Who were the founders of this college?
What are some significant milestones in the history of this college?
I'm interested in learning about the historical development of this college.
How did this college come into existence?
Could you provide me with key events in the history of this college?
responses:
The Sona Group is steeped in more than 100 years of success and tradition tracing back to pre-Independence. The group was founded by the doyen of textile industries of the early twentieth century, Karumuttu Thiagarajar Chettiar. He oozed passion and patriotism for his motherland and fought for Her freedom along with other great freedom fighters of this nation. Karumuttu Thiagarajar Chettiar’s prominence is etched in the tapestry of our nation by the role he played in the transformation of Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi to Gandhiji, The Father of our Nation. This defining moment played out in 1938, within the walls of Karumuttu Thiagarajar Chettiar’s home when Gandhiji visited Madurai. Gandhiji wore his trademark Loin cloth, vowing not to wear a shirt every again after seeing daily wage workers who could not afford one.
Karumuttu Thiagarajar Chettiar saw the plight of workers in the plantations and fought for their liberation. His idea of liberation was to set people free and even to a higher level of setting minds free through education. He envisioned an Indian nation that would stand tall in the global stage built on its robust educated society with its traditional values and wealth. He set this idea in motion by establishing Thiagarajar Engineering College in Madurai, and Thiagarajar Polytechnic College, Salem, and sowed the seeds of quality technical education in India. Those seeds now stand as a global brand called ‘Sona’ whose roots run deep into education, textile, IT, research, manufacturing, outsourcing, logistics and many more. The Sona Group’s quest to cater quality higher education has led to its banyan tree like growth with Thiagarajar Polytechnic College, Sona College of Technology, Sona School of Management, Sona College of Arts and Science , Sona Valliappa Public School and Sona Medical College of Naturopathy and Yoga.
